lorienradar: I believe this message needs to be heard far and wide. Even when I sit normally, I still have to adjust my stomach regardless of my size. mumblingintothevoid: I’ve been hoping to make my way down to a weight where I felt comfortable, and I really needed to hear this because I’ve been so stuck not doing the things I want because it’s ‘not right at this weight’. zo2showtime: Take the belly out of the yoga pants. Let it be free
bubblegum_bxby: This is beautiful, I think about this often ❤️
_ms_holly_: I love this. I avoided yoga for a long time because it wasn't working the way I thought it should. My friend (a yoga teacher) taught me how to do yoga in my body. Thanks for sharing this! It's stuff like this that helps me in my journey.

le_ballvini: This is so perfectly relatable. Thank you!!!👌🏼💞
ellalabellaaa: Thank you so much for voicing this, it's so important! ❤️
momster.gina: How interesting! I've never actually heard anyone say this and I'm so glad you did. I will be using this kind of sentiment more myself. soph_opera: Thank you for your honesty and kind example Corissa! Everyone deserves to do the things they love in the body they have right now.
poppy__and_mattie: You are amazing ❤️ Next time I do yoga I feel like I’ll have the confidence to try this. Thank you for all the work you do—because let’s be real, you have to do a lot of emotional labor that goes unpaid just to exist and lift others up. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

caruanagiselle: Thank you for this, as some one who has a genuine hatred for my body and how I look as a whole and having hated my body and face as a size 10 and equally as a size 32 and still as a size 22/24 you have actually started to make me realise that I don't have to suck my stomach in untill I faint ( actually did this at a friend's party ) that it's ok to breath normally and adjust myself to feel comfortable so thank you, you are truly beautiful from the outside in ❤️❤️❤️

strong_in_the_broken_places: I love this post! I really need to get into a good practice. Yoga is where I can be free. I let my body move and tell me what it wants to do, not the other way round.
